org.apache.daffodil.japi

Class Compiler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.daffodil.japi.Compiler

  • public class Compiler
extends java.lang.Object
    Compile DFDL schemas into ProcessorFactory's or reload saved parsers into DataProcessor's.

    Do not use the Compiler constructor to create a Compiler. Instead, use Daffodil.compiler().

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • compileFile

        public ProcessorFactory compileFile(java.io.File schemaFile)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Compile DFDL schema file into a ProcessorFactory

        To allow jar-file packaging, (where schema files might be part of a jar), it is recommended to use compileSource(java.net.URI) instead.

        Parameters:
        schemaFile - DFDL schema file used to create a ProcessorFactory.
        Returns:
        ProcessorFactory used to create DataProcessor(s). Must check WithDiagnostics.isError() before using it.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the schemaFile

      • compileFile

        public ProcessorFactory compileFile(java.io.File schemaFile,
                                    java.lang.String rootName,
                                    java.lang.String rootNamespace)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Compile DFDL schema file into a ProcessorFactory

        To allow jar-file packaging, (where schema files might be part of a jar), it is recommended to use compileSource(java.net.URI) instead.

        Parameters:
        schemaFile - DFDL schema file used to create a ProcessorFactory.
        rootName - name of root element, or null to choose automatically from first element of schema.
        rootNamespace - String of namespace of the root element, or null to infer automatically when unambiguous. Pass "" (empty string) for No Namespace.*
        Returns:
        ProcessorFactory used to create DataProcessor(s). Must check WithDiagnostics.isError() before using it.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the schemaFile

      • compileSource

        public ProcessorFactory compileSource(java.net.URI uri)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Compile DFDL schema source into a ProcessorFactory

        Parameters:
        uri - URI of DFDL schema file used to create a ProcessorFactory.
        Returns:
        ProcessorFactory used to create DataProcessor(s). Must check WithDiagnostics.isError() before using it.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the uri

      • compileSource

        public ProcessorFactory compileSource(java.net.URI uri,
                                      java.lang.String rootName,
                                      java.lang.String rootNamespace)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Compile DFDL schema source into a ProcessorFactory

        Parameters:
        uri - URI of DFDL schema file used to create a ProcessorFactory.
        rootName - name of root element, or null to choose automatically from first element of schema.
        rootNamespace - String of namespace of the root element, or null to infer automatically when unambiguous. Pass "" (empty string) for No Namespace.
        Returns:
        ProcessorFactory used to create DataProcessor(s). Must check WithDiagnostics.isError() before using it.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the uri

      • reload

        public DataProcessor reload(java.io.File savedParser)
                     throws InvalidParserException
        Reload a saved parser from a file

        To allow jar-file packaging, (where the savedParser might be part of a jar), it is recommended to use the other version of reload(java.nio.channels.ReadableByteChannel) where the argument is a ReadableByteChannel for a saved parser.

        Parameters:
        savedParser - file of a saved parser, created with DataProcessor.save(java.nio.channels.WritableByteChannel)

        Returns:
        DataProcessor used to parse data. Must check WithDiagnostics.isError() before using it.

        Throws:
        InvalidParserException - if the file is not a valid saved parser.

      • reload

        public DataProcessor reload(java.nio.channels.ReadableByteChannel savedParser)
                     throws InvalidParserException
        Reload a saved parser from a ReadableByteChannel

        Parameters:
        savedParser - ReadableByteChannel of a saved parser, created with DataProcessor.save(java.nio.channels.WritableByteChannel)

        Returns:
        DataProcessor used to parse data. Must check WithDiagnostics.isError() before using it.

        Throws:
        InvalidParserException - if the file is not a valid saved parser.

      • setDistinguishedRootNode

        public void setDistinguishedRootNode(java.lang.String name,
                                     java.lang.String namespace)
        Deprecated. Pass arguments to compileSource, or compileFile. Since 2.6.0.
        Specify a global element to be the root of DFDL Schema to start parsing

        Parameters:
        name - name of the root node
        namespace - namespace of the root node. Set to empty string to specify no namespace. Set to to NULL to figure out the namespace.

      • setExternalDFDLVariable

        public void setExternalDFDLVariable(java.lang.String name,
                                    java.lang.String namespace,
                                    java.lang.String value)
        Deprecated. Use DataProcessor.withExternalVariable. Since 2.6.0.
        Set the value of a DFDL variable

        Parameters:
        name - name of the variable
        namespace - namespace of the variable. Set to empty string to specify no namespace. Set to to NULL to figure out the namespace.
        value - value to so the variable to

      • setExternalDFDLVariables

        public void setExternalDFDLVariables(java.util.AbstractMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> extVarsMap)
        Deprecated. Use DataProcessor.withExternalVariables. Since 2.6.0.
        Set the value of multiple DFDL variables

        Parameters:
        extVarsMap - a may of key/value pairs, where the key is the variable name, and the value is the value of the variable. The key may be preceded by a string of the form "{namespace}" to define a namespace for the variable. If preceded with "{}", then no namespace is used. With not preceded by "{namespace}", then Daffodil will figure out the namespace.

      • setExternalDFDLVariables

        public void setExternalDFDLVariables(java.io.File extVarsFile)
        Deprecated. Use DataProcessor.withExternalVariables. Since 2.6.0.
        Read external variables from a Daffodil configuration file

        Parameters:
        extVarsFile - file to read DFDL variables from.
        See Also:
        Daffodil Configuration File - Daffodil configuration file format

      • setTunable

        public void setTunable(java.lang.String tunable,
                       java.lang.String value)
        Deprecated. Use withTunable. Since 2.6.0.
        Set a Daffodil tunable parameter

        Parameters:
        tunable - name of the tunable parameter to set.
        value - value of the tunable parameter to set
        See Also:
        Tunable Parameters - list of tunables names of default values

      • setTunables

        public void setTunables(java.util.AbstractMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> tunables)
        Deprecated. Use withTunables. Since 2.6.0.
        Set the value of multiple tunable parameters

        Parameters:
        tunables - a map of key/value pairs, where the key is the tunable name and the value is the value to set it to
        See Also:
        Tunable Parameters - list of tunables names of default values

      • setValidateDFDLSchemas

        public void setValidateDFDLSchemas(boolean value)
        Deprecated. Do not use this method. DFDL schema validation should be performed. Since 2.6.0.
        Enable/disable DFDL validation of resulting infoset with the DFDL schema

        Parameters:
        value - true to enable validation, false to disabled
